    public class AllocateReleasePoolOfTokens
extends PoolOfTokens
    Implements a Pool of Token for couples of Allocate - Release Nodes
    Author:
    Daniele Gianni

    • Constructor Detail

      • AllocateReleasePoolOfTokens

        public AllocateReleasePoolOfTokens(JEQNName name,
                           JEQNTimeFactory timeFactory,
                           it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.factories.Layer3ToLayer2Factory layer2factory,
                           TokenFactory tokenFactory,
                           double tokenAllocateEventAckDelay,
                           double tokenReleaseEventAckDelay)
                            throws it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.exceptions.InvalidNameException
        Creates a new instance of AllocateReleasePoolOfTokens
        Parameters:
        name - Element name. The name is used to identify entities within the simulation model.
        timeFactory - Instances the jEQN time object that contains the value for the simulation time.
        layer2factory - According to the Factory pattern, factory is used to instantiates the implementation of Layer3ToLayer2 interface, which provides level 3 services to level 2.
        tokenFactory - Factory that generate the tokens
        tokenAllocateEventAckDelay - The delay time introduced to send a token. It constitutes the response to the token request submitted by the Allocate node.
        tokenReleaseEventAckDelay - The delay time introduced to get back a token. It constitutes the response to the token release request submitted by the Release node.
        Throws:
        it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.exceptions.InvalidNameException - An InvalidNameException is raised when an issue concerning the element name occurs.
